title: How has nihilism helped you? - Quora

response.answer_text: If we assume my definition of nihilism (here: Vinney Cavallo's answer to What motivation and/or rationale does a nihilist have for doing anything, other than “Why not?”? ) then: it can be helpful to have your worldview map closely onto the truth. Namely, the universe has no inherent meaning nor objective moral truths or laws. Aligning your personal expectations of reality closely to how reality actually works means you’ll be less likely to have unrealistic expectations, such as: “good things happen to good people”, “X happened for a reason”, “if I do X and Y I’ll receive Z reward after I’m dead”. These are all bullshit and it’s typically unwise to use bullshit as a foundation for life strategies - like expecting gravity to work differently for you on the 15th floor, for instance. The shorter answer is: Maybe the rejection of objective meaning hasn’t been helpful to a given “nihilist”. Doesn’t change the fact that it’s true. I’m not sure why this question assumes nihilism has helped people. If a realist is truly being a realist, he/she doesn’t believe something because it’s helpful, but because it’s empirically true.

Similer to how evil could help a person. By assimilating it into your being you won’t be caught off gaurd when it comes up in the real world. To add, I would say if you place yourself above anything to do with nihilism you could risk becoming too sage like, ect. Have a nice balence, be a “person of the mountain and of the vally”. See both the meaning and meaninglessness that life has to offer. Side note: it seems to me an osolation of meaningfullness and nihlism drives heavy the pistons of contemporary inquiry. Perhaps we have found our generations need for a new Faust. It is no longer with devils that wisper on our ears. It is the bombardment of the meaningless escapism. -Just my opinion
Actually,it did not. However,it “helped” me produce several antibodies in order to fight with this painful existential angst…It did not help me fight reality-It just made me less sensitive…
Nihilism has shown me the negative of my actual Worldview. While a theistic worldview is usually drenched in hope, nihilism is one of the absence of hope and a resignation to dying alone
